definitions.definition: A horizontal bar extending between supports and used for support or as a barrier ; a railing .
The metal bar forming part of the track for a railroad .
A railroad ; a railway , as a means of transportation .
examples: We travelled to the seaside by rail .
a small Scottish village not accessible by rail

definitions.definition: ( electronics ) A conductor maintained at a fixed electrical potential relative to ground , to which other circuit components are connected .
examples: ISA devices draw power from the +5 V, −5 V, +12 V, and −12 V rails of the power supply unit.

definitions.definition: A horizontal piece of wood that serves to separate sections of a door or window .
( surfing ) One of the lengthwise edges of a surfboard .
( Internet ) A vertical section on one side of a web page .
examples: We're experimenting with ads in the right-hand rail .

definitions.definition: ( drugs ) A large line ( portion or serving of a powdery illegal drug ) .
Each of two vertical side bars supporting the rungs of a ladder .
( backgammon ) The raised edge of the game board.

main_definition: A horizontal bar extending between supports and used for support or as a barrier ; a railing .
secondary_definitions: The metal bar forming part of the track for a railroad .
A railroad ; a railway , as a means of transportation .

definitions.definition: Any of several birds in the family Rallidae .

main_definition: Any of several birds in the family Rallidae .

definitions.definition: An item of clothing ; a cloak or other garment ; a dress .
Specifically, a woman 's headscarf or neckerchief .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) An item of clothing ; a cloak or other garment ; a dress .
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) Specifically, a woman 's headscarf or neckerchief .
